evals.prompt: Design a landing page for a developer API platform called Arcline. It provides unified API access to multiple LLM providers. Make it premium and dark.
evals.expected_output: A single HTML file with dark theme, CSS/SVG product mockups, scroll animations, proper accessibility, and zero external images
expectations: Output is a single .html file
Uses the dark surface stack (--bg, --surface, --surface-2, --surface-3 CSS variables)
Contains at least one CSS/SVG product UI mockup (dashboard, code view, or API response visualization)
Has IntersectionObserver-based scroll reveal animations
Includes prefers-reduced-motion media query
Has a skip-to-main link
Uses semantic HTML landmarks (nav, main, footer)
Contains no external image URLs (no img src to external URLs, no background-image url to external URLs)
Has ARIA labels on interactive elements
Uses Inter or a system font stack
Contains a clear CTA in the hero section
Has focus-visible styles defined
Contains realistic copy (not lorem ipsum)

evals.prompt: Build me a product page for a project management tool called Taskflow. It should have a kanban board mockup, animated workflow connectors, and a bento grid section. Apple style with Linear aesthetics.
evals.expected_output: A single HTML file with Apple-style layout, kanban board CSS mockup, SVG workflow connectors with dash animation, and bento grid with mini-UIs
expectations: Output is a single .html file
Contains a CSS kanban board mockup with multiple columns
Has SVG animated connectors using stroke-dasharray
Includes a bento grid section with at least 3 cards
Bento cards contain mini-UI components (not just text/icons)
Uses CSS custom properties for the color system
Sections have generous vertical padding (80px+)
Contains no external image URLs
Has prefers-reduced-motion support
Page has a narrative flow (hero → features → proof → CTA)

evals.prompt: Create a landing page for an AI code review tool called ReviewBot. Include a sliding gallery of feature cards, ring stats showing performance metrics, and an animated gradient mesh hero. Make it look like it belongs on Linear's website.
evals.expected_output: A single HTML file with gradient mesh hero, draggable gallery, SVG ring stats, Linear-style aesthetic, and full accessibility
expectations: Output is a single .html file
Hero has an animated gradient mesh background (blurred orbs or similar)
Contains a horizontal gallery/carousel with multiple cards
Gallery supports mouse drag or scroll interaction
Has SVG circular progress indicators (ring stats)
Ring stats animate on scroll (IntersectionObserver triggered)
Uses the violet/pink/orange gradient accent palette
Has a logos marquee or social proof section
Contains no external image URLs
Accessibility: skip link, landmarks, ARIA labels, reduced-motion, focus-visible all present
